text: Hi Kobe Kapoor, developers can create a _developer test account_ or a _standard sandbox account_. Test accounts have access to enterprise versions of the HubSpot Marketing, Sales, and Service Hubs, allowing developers to test most HubSpot tools and APIs. You can also go through this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/account-types>
Hi guys
So… how do y’all fight this? Over 2s due to HubSpot js
Good morning guys, I need to add the HubSpot munchkin code and I don't know how to do it, do you have any idea how to do it?

I dont´have a solution but i have a relevant Post in the idea forum from last year regarding this: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Disable-scripts-that-are-not-needed/idi-p/599178#M107395>
this would kinda require a little more custom work and wouldn't really be something someone can send 10 lines of code to accomplish. you might want to post in <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs>
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1680443833296129>

What are the `75856068270` and `1663083749367` numbers representing here? I assume one is a build compilation number, and the other I’m not sure. And is there any way to link to a HubSpot theme asset absolutely outside of HubSpot? i.e. without those 2 numbers, to just always use the latest version of the asset?
<https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/[portalId]/hub_generated/template_assets/75856068270/1663083749367/[themeFolder]/css/cookie-banner.css>

yeah. This is kinda inline with <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/CMS-Templates-API-Add-rendered-html-Field/idi-p/466446|this old idea> on rendered assets. We at least need the ability to grab rendered assets via api. But a `/latest` on css assets would be amazing too.
in a headless world, this kinda stuff seems like a must

I’ve brought this up before but when is someone at HubSpot going to fix this page it’s been well over a year.
Waiting for more that 2 seconds means a page is broken, waiting more than 30 means it’s horribly broken, surely the page can’t be that hard to fix???
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions>
Yeah it's terrible, especially the sidebar

Hey HubSpot team,

Regarding my dilemma, I work with <http://reviews.io|reviews.io> and we have syndication together I've been trying to figure out a huge step in our current integrations regarding our dynamic link feature as this is the method we are using to help our clients collect reviews through your platform please view the example below:

<https://www.reviews.io/store/landing_new_review?store=www.londonspeechworkshop.com&user=><customer name>&order_id=<order reference>&email=<customer email address>&products=<product sku>&l=<language>&type=<review type>&video_campaign_id=<video_campaign_id>

What I need help with is figuring out which placeholders you currently have to allow our clients to collect  customer name, email, order ID, review type, and product SKU this identifier might be called something different on your end.

I would really appreciate it if we can figure this out.
Thank you
I'd reach out to HubSpot support. This slack isn't an official HubSpot support channel

Hi all :wave: , got this question from my manager :point_down:
> The passthrough values and values for country and state in HS forms that we're using...can you share what the format for those naming conventions are (i.e. Texas vs TX)? We just want to make sure that we're being consistent and using the same format. 
Can someone confirm that the values follow the ISO-3166 country and state list? Thanks in advance.
they are actually just text fields
country and state
not a select
is it Country a select?
That's not a default HubSpot property for country but it looks like that is a select

if there are no values set for the default HS properties, either of these fields can be modified to a dropdown and you can import the values you want to use.

Once you have contacts/companies using the property, you can't change it from a rich text field without moving the data out of the field to another property first and then writing a workflow to move it back/match it up with the new values in the dropdown
If I remember correctly, you can also load predefined values for states, countries, day of week, etc. but I haven't done this in a few years
without first making it a select?
you have to make it a dropdown first, but then there should be a preload option. I'm checking a test portal now
yep you definitely can do that
I thought you meant limiting the single line text field to only accepting certain values
I was like that's interesting...
oh, no.. not limiting the single line text, but once you load the options you can limit to just those that you want/need
yep exactly
All makes sense! Appreciate the help :heart:

Hey, has anyone found issues with the facebook messenger and HubSpot integration?

We have facebook ads that go to messenger and when someone clicks the ad, it sends their data to HubSpot through the meta API as a “form submission” giving us attribution and ad interactions, we only get first and last name though. But then when they start messaging us from that ad, HubSpot inbox picks up the conversation and creates a new contact with the same name but no attribution, this contact though has the inbox history.
So we end up with 2 contacts, and half the information we want on each contact.

I am considering creating an ops custom code workflow that combines the two contacts if they have the same name and are created within a few minutes of eachother but this solution is a bit clunky, and not ideal as we could get 2 people messaging with the same name (not common, but again not ideal)
Hi guys,. anyone tried the Content Assistant beta of HubSpot? did it work on your end?
